Description: Fragment of an ostracon from a pottery vessel, parts of three lines of hieratic written in black ink are preserved, the rest is broken off. Maybe a list, as the same sign seems to be repeated in a smaller scale in each line. The vessel is made of Nile clay, closed shape, cream slip on outside, wheel made, most likely an amphora. The object was glued. Some white accretions on surface.
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 57, 58)
